data: [{"1767": {"title": "The Basement", "category": ["Music Video", "All"], "description": " The Basement is your typical high school outcast love story. Falling hard for someone as we watch them fall for someone else. Literally tearing your heart out both mentally and physically. Our main character seems to be in a day dream. The basement was filmed in the Adirondacks and showcases some of Lake George\u2019s finest attractions like The Magic Forrest (RIP). People\u2019s Pixel Project winner", "video_link": "", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/basement-481x410.jpg", "location": "Charles R. Wood Theater", "date": "03/05/2020 03:11 PM to 03/05/2020 04:26 PM,03/03/2020 06:17 AM to 03/03/2020 10:00 AM"}}, {"1713": {"title": "Wanting", "category": ["Experimental", "Short", "All"], "description": " Wanting is an exploration in intimacy and space \u2013 not having all that is needed or expected; to lack or be short of something essential.", "video_link": "https://player.vimeo.com/video/335518342?dnt=1&app_id=122963", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/wanting-481x410.png", "location": "The Queensbury Hotel", "date": "03/01/2020 11:59 PM to 03/01/2020 10:41 PM,03/02/2020 08:43 PM to 03/02/2020 07:11 PM"}}, {"1673": {"title": "Anxiety's Wilma", "category": ["Comedy", "Short", "All"], "description": " Anxiety\u2019s Wilma is a short romantic comedy about a young woman and her anxiety.", "video_link": "", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/anxiety-481x410.jpeg", "location": "The Queensbury Hotel", "date": "03/02/2020 09:29 PM to 03/02/2020 08:30 PM,03/03/2020 04:02 PM to 03/03/2020 05:36 PM"}}, {"1820": {"title": "THIRD WHEEL", "category": ["Comedy", "Short", "All"], "description": " Three friends on a coffee date are unable to distinguish who amongst them is the third wheel.", "video_link": "", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/third-wheel-481x410.jpeg", "location": "Crandall Public Library", "date": "03/06/2020 02:24 PM to 03/06/2020 03:20 PM,03/07/2020 12:34 AM to 03/07/2020 12:48 PM"}}, {"1735": {"title": "Adulting", "category": ["Comedy", "Special Event", "All"], "description": " Eight twenty-somethings living in New York City struggle to adapt to a changing definition of adulthood while they mess up every personal and professional relationship they have worked to establish. Is this adulthood? \u00a0", "video_link": "", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/Screen-Shot-2019-09-01-at-1.01.42-PM-481x410.png", "location": "Crandall Public Library", "date": "03/01/2020 11:39 AM to 03/01/2020 04:53 PM,03/04/2020 12:23 PM to 03/04/2020 12:37 PM"}}, {"1632": {"title": "Come at Me, Bro", "category": ["Comedy", "Short", "All"], "description": " Two queer men find a creative way to release their pent-up aggression.", "video_link": "", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/COME-AT-ME-481x410.jpeg", "location": "Charles R. Wood Theater", "date": "03/04/2020 03:24 AM to 03/04/2020 03:43 AM,03/02/2020 03:05 PM to 03/02/2020 04:22 PM"}}, {"1665": {"title": "Connie", "category": ["Doc", "Short", "All"], "description": " A short documentary following Connie Avery, an artist who is legally blind from Utica, New York, and how she develops her unique style through the fragmentation and distortions of paint, acrylic ink, and other artistic mediums.", "video_link": "", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/connie-481x410.png", "location": "Crandall Public Library", "date": "03/06/2020 02:02 PM to 03/06/2020 02:45 PM,03/04/2020 03:51 AM to 03/04/2020 05:44 PM"}}, {"1751": {"title": "I Taste Blood", "category": ["Experimental", "Short", "All"], "description": " An exploration of resistance through spoken word and dance. \u201cI Taste Blood\u201d is a collaborative experimental work by poet Lauren Sotolongo, choreographer Samanatha Sobash, filmmaker Russell Sheaffer, and composer Aaron Michael Smith.", "video_link": "", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/blood-481x410.jpeg", "location": "The Park Theater", "date": "03/05/2020 02:32 AM to 03/05/2020 03:35 AM,03/05/2020 11:19 AM to 03/05/2020 02:43 PM"}}, {"1639": {"title": "Shine in the Darkness", "category": ["Doc", "Short", "All"], "description": " Ultra-Endurance athlete Stefanie Bishop (Death Race & World\u2019s Toughest Mudder Champion) attempts to become the first woman to consecutively hike all 46 High Peaks of the Adirondacks in the winter, but as the expedition progresses things take an unexpected turn and Stef\u2019s strength and will power are pushed to their limits. \u201cEmbrace adventure and the challenges that accompany it. Smile through the adversity. Shine in the darkness. Discover yourself.\u201d \u2013 Stef Bishop \u00a0", "video_link": "https://player.vimeo.com/video/321234240?dnt=1&app_id=122963", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/shine-481x410.png", "location": "Charles R. Wood Theater Cabaret Space", "date": "03/03/2020 12:52 AM to 03/03/2020 01:28 AM,03/06/2020 11:40 PM to 03/06/2020 08:32 PM"}}, {"1679": {"title": "Dawnland", "category": ["Doc", "Feature", "All"], "description": " For decades, child welfare authorities have been removing Native American children from their homes to save them from being Indian. In Maine, the first official \u201ctruth and reconciliation commission\u201d in the United States begins a historic investigation. DAWNLAND goes behind-the-scenes as this historic body grapples with difficult truths, redefines reconciliation, and charts a new course for state and tribal relations. \u00a0", "video_link": "https://player.vimeo.com/video/227346667?dnt=1&app_id=122963", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/dawnland-481x410.jpeg", "location": "Charles R. Wood Theater Cabaret Space", "date": "03/04/2020 12:54 PM to 03/04/2020 02:47 PM,03/01/2020 10:03 PM to 03/01/2020 08:39 PM"}}, {"1669": {"title": "Meat Eater", "category": ["Comedy", "Experimental", "Short", "All"], "description": " A woman in the woods makes her escape.", "video_link": "https://player.vimeo.com/video/315734798?dnt=1&app_id=122963", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/meat-eater-481x410.png", "location": "Charles R. Wood Theater Cabaret Space", "date": "03/03/2020 04:25 PM to 03/03/2020 05:38 PM,03/05/2020 06:14 AM to 03/05/2020 11:11 AM"}}, {"1706": {"title": "Rebuilding Puerto Rico", "category": ["Doc", "Short", "All"], "description": " \u201cFed up with the slow response for survivors of Hurricane Maria, Vermont-based volunteers take matters into their own hands. They rebuild homes in Puerto Rico and forge lasting friendships with a mother (Deloys), her five-year-old son (Carlos) and family. Among the volunteers are five high school students, who encounter life-changing experiences and overcome challenges and project delays. The group helps as many families as possible in just one week.\u201d", "video_link": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/nZgO10HLn5A?feature=oembed", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/puerto-rico-481x410.jpeg", "location": "The Park Theater", "date": "03/04/2020 09:45 PM to 03/04/2020 09:11 PM,03/04/2020 12:15 PM to 03/04/2020 02:25 PM"}}, {"1811": {"title": "Home: The Children of the Interstices", "category": ["Doc", "Short", "All"], "description": " This essay film, using a spoken word poem and found footage, documents the experience of a Moroccan woman, Sarah, who takes the viewer on a journey to discover the conflicting aspects of her identity, by showcasing the stark contrast between the traditional \u201cmedina\u201d (old city) and the modern city center. Starting with a dissection of the image of Morocco in the collective imagination of tourists, the poem shifts to a more personal account of Sarah\u2019s personal relationship to being Moroccan, how studying abroad has impacted that, and the conflicts that arise from being seen as foreign despite being a local. Merging theories on development, modernity, globalization, and orientalism with a personal account, Home: Wlad les Interstices raises questions on what it means to be part of the diaspora and its implications on identity and relations to one\u2019s home country.", "video_link": "", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/Screen-Shot-2019-09-03-at-22.26.23-481x410.png", "location": "The Park Theater", "date": "03/04/2020 05:36 PM to 03/04/2020 06:01 PM,03/05/2020 04:35 AM to 03/05/2020 02:07 PM"}}, {"1733": {"title": "Super Sonic", "category": ["Drama", "Short", "All"], "description": " A probing and heartfelt account of a hard of hearing individual who finds love on the dance floor. An ode to the power of body language and empathy when words fail us.", "video_link": "https://player.vimeo.com/video/345057718?dnt=1&app_id=122963", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/super-sonic-481x410.png", "location": "The Queensbury Hotel", "date": "03/06/2020 10:30 AM to 03/06/2020 06:37 PM,03/05/2020 12:31 PM to 03/05/2020 01:36 PM"}}, {"1812": {"title": "The Minor League Mecca", "category": ["Doc", "Feature", "All"], "description": " As the premier franchise in the Continental Basketball Association from 1982 to 1992, the Albany Patroons left an indelible mark on the city of Albany, the CBA and the NBA. From elite coaches like Phil Jackson, Bill Musselman and George Karl to standout players like Michael Ray Richardson, Mario Elie, Tony Campbell, Sidney Lowe, Rick Carlisle and Scott Brooks, the Patroons\u2019 legacy continues to shape the world of professional basketball. We are working to bring you the untold story of the Patroons\u2019 quick rise, championship success and ultimate downfall. Beyond the franchise\u2019s ups and downs, the stories of the individuals involved, from fans, to executives to coaches and players are implausible, hilarious and inspiring. \u00a0", "video_link": "https://player.vimeo.com/video/204601473?dnt=1&app_id=122963", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/minor-league-481x410.jpeg", "location": "Charles R. Wood Theater", "date": "03/07/2020 12:16 PM to 03/07/2020 03:18 PM,03/01/2020 10:06 AM to 03/01/2020 06:15 PM"}}, {"1676": {"title": "Change", "category": ["Drama", "Short", "All"], "description": " A mother and her daughter have a late-night conversation at the laundromat about life until a sudden turn of events changes the course of their night.", "video_link": "", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/change-481x410.jpeg", "location": "The Park Theater", "date": "03/05/2020 11:39 AM to 03/05/2020 02:49 PM,03/03/2020 11:30 PM to 03/03/2020 08:15 PM"}}, {"1692": {"title": "Camp Wedding", "category": ["Comedy", "Feature", "All"], "description": " Mia\u2019s wedding party is not too keen on transforming a dilapidated summer camp into the wedding venue of her dreams. When people begin disappearing, that doesn\u2019t help either\u2026 \u00a0", "video_link": "https://player.vimeo.com/video/316670133?dnt=1&app_id=122963", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/camp-wedding-2-481x410.jpeg", "location": "Charles R. Wood Theater", "date": "03/06/2020 05:05 AM to 03/06/2020 09:06 AM,03/07/2020 06:13 AM to 03/07/2020 12:16 PM"}}, {"1636": {"title": "Cat", "category": ["Comedy", "Short", "All"], "description": " Jo agrees to cat sit for the weekend, thinking it will be an easy gig. Obviously, he\u2019s never had a cat before. After countless failed attempts to bond with the cat, Jo gives up and decides to head to bed. When the lights go out, the cat seeks his revenge and Jo finds out he\u2019s bitten off more than he can chew.", "video_link": "", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/CAT-481x410.png", "location": "The Park Theater", "date": "03/05/2020 02:55 PM to 03/05/2020 04:10 PM,03/02/2020 06:21 PM to 03/02/2020 06:41 PM"}}, {"1784": {"title": "The Pact", "category": ["Drama", "Short", "All"], "description": " Betty and Frank attend a seminar about euthanasia. Eddie is a doctor who advocates and facilitates people\u2019s right to choose death. During the seminar, Betty reveals she has Alzheimers. Frank, however, appears physically and mentally fit. At home, Betty and Frank\u2019s family are gathered. It is the eve of their suicide pact. It\u2019s sad but the family has been briefed: this is a celebration of life! But when one of their children show up, devastated, and berate their parents\u2019 decision, the cold reality hits home. Eddie arrives with the nitrogen tanks. Isla puts on the couple\u2019s favourite song and together Betty and Frank inhale the noxious gas. But as unconsciousness takes hold, Frank rips his mask off. He tries to remove Betty\u2019s but she clings to it \u2013 her decision made.", "video_link": "", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/pact-481x410.jpeg", "location": "Charles R. Wood Theater Cabaret Space", "date": "03/06/2020 09:43 AM to 03/06/2020 10:32 AM,03/03/2020 03:53 AM to 03/03/2020 12:07 PM"}}, {"1721": {"title": "The Shallow End", "category": ["Comedy", "Drama", "Short", "All"], "description": " Set during the summer of 1984 at a suburban community swimming pool, The Shallow End centers around Addie, a bookish 14-year old who is torn between the popular clique and the lone oddball. When the girls are unexpectedly confronted with some very grown up challenges, Addie discovers the meaning of true friendship and struggles to cultivate the courage to break away from the shallow end.", "video_link": "", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/shallow-481x410.jpeg", "location": "The Park Theater", "date": "03/03/2020 03:16 PM to 03/03/2020 05:27 PM,03/07/2020 01:12 PM to 03/07/2020 01:25 PM"}}, {"1659": {"title": "The Last Doll Lady", "category": ["Doc", "Short", "All"], "description": " In the 1950s a program called Dolls for Democracy was started. Women known as \u201c\u201ddoll ladies\u201d\u201d would travel to local schools and teach children, through the use of hand carved wooden character dolls, about why racism and intolerance is wrong. Over the decades the program has faded into obscurity, but one woman has made it her life\u2019s mission to reignite a nations passion for the programs hopeful message. Selma Bukstein was one of the original doll ladies, now 60 years later and at the age of 91, she is the last doll lady. The Last Doll Lady follows Selma\u2019s efforts to revitalize the program and pass on its legacy to a new generation.", "video_link": "https://player.vimeo.com/video/232919545?dnt=1&app_id=122963", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/doll-lady-481x410.jpeg", "location": "Charles R. Wood Theater Cabaret Space", "date": "03/02/2020 11:36 PM to 03/02/2020 08:41 PM,03/05/2020 12:41 AM to 03/05/2020 03:36 PM"}}, {"1715": {"title": "Power Out", "category": ["Drama", "Short", "All"], "description": " Five friends enjoy a night of fun, games, and politics, until an unexpected event leaves them wondering who has their hand on the switch?", "video_link": "https://player.vimeo.com/video/357577166?dnt=1&app_id=122963", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/power-out-poster-481x410.jpg", "location": "Crandall Public Library", "date": "03/07/2020 10:20 AM to 03/07/2020 10:48 AM,03/06/2020 06:31 AM to 03/06/2020 05:37 PM"}}, {"1634": {"title": "Suncatcher", "category": ["Drama", "Short", "All"], "description": " For months Kira has been living out of her car in Venice, California. Today that changes. Facing a constant struggle to keep her head above water, Kira\u2019s world collapses when she returns home from work one evening to find her car stolen. Vulnerable and alone, Kira must navigate the harrowing uncertainty of a night on the streets. Featuring the world famous poetry of Jalal al-Din Rumi, as translated by Coleman Barks in its first cinematic adaptation, Suncatcher is a piercing exploration of mindfulness in the face of crisis. A haunting meditation that captures both the stunning beauty, and perilous isolation, of life on the fringes of Los Angeles\u2019s coastal westside.", "video_link": "", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/SUNCATCHER-481x410.jpeg", "location": "Charles R. Wood Theater Cabaret Space", "date": "03/04/2020 09:23 PM to 03/04/2020 07:16 PM,03/05/2020 01:57 PM to 03/05/2020 02:59 PM"}}, {"1657": {"title": "A Blue Sky Like No Other", "category": ["Doc", "Short", "All"], "description": " On September 11, 2001, Wall Street executive Steven Fetter was a block away when the South Tower of the World Trade Center came down. As the grey dust cloud overcame him, Fetter believed that his life would then be over. \u201cA Blue Sky Like No Other\u201d is a documentary short in which Fetter offers an eyewitness perspective of that day, memorializes the heroes who lost their lives while saving others, and explains how surviving that tragedy led him to change his life by leaving Wall Street and heading West. \u201cBlue Sky\u201d is based on Fetter\u2019s one-person play that he earlier presented in New York City (where it was designated a Critics\u2019 Pick by Time Out New York) and Rochester (NY). \u00a0", "video_link": "", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/blue-sky-481x410.jpeg", "location": "Charles R. Wood Theater", "date": "03/01/2020 10:16 PM to 03/01/2020 07:24 PM,03/03/2020 03:34 PM to 03/03/2020 04:16 PM"}}, {"1822": {"title": "INTO MY LIFE", "category": ["Doc", "Short", "All"], "description": " From 1965 to the present, M. Elaine and Cassandra Bromfield, two black women, documented their lives and community in Brooklyn\u2019s Lindsay Park Housing Cooperative on 8-mm film. \u201cInto My Life\u201d pays tribute to their drive for self-preservation and self-representation, highlighting the memories, identities, and relationships housed within their archive.", "video_link": "https://player.vimeo.com/video/259025193?dnt=1&app_id=122963", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/into-my-life-481x410.jpeg", "location": "Charles R. Wood Theater", "date": "03/04/2020 08:48 PM to 03/04/2020 08:28 PM,03/06/2020 07:05 PM to 03/06/2020 07:01 PM"}}, {"1595": {"title": "Sad Hour", "category": ["Comedy", "Experimental", "Short", "All"], "description": " Like many, Mildew\u2019s allergic to happiness, which is why he\u2019ll spend the next hour safely tucked away at his least favorite tavern. \u00a0", "video_link": "https://player.vimeo.com/video/305809831?dnt=1&app_id=122963", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/SAD-HOUR-481x410.png", "location": "Crandall Public Library", "date": "03/05/2020 06:32 PM to 03/05/2020 06:48 PM,03/01/2020 03:58 PM to 03/01/2020 04:06 PM"}}, {"1743": {"title": "Believin'", "category": ["Comedy", "Drama", "Short", "All"], "description": " A comedy about mourning.", "video_link": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/ii2KtU4LYx0?feature=oembed", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/believin-481x410.jpeg", "location": "The Queensbury Hotel", "date": "03/03/2020 11:28 PM to 03/03/2020 07:11 PM,03/02/2020 10:06 PM to 03/02/2020 09:52 PM"}}, {"1809": {"title": "The Wind Phone", "category": ["Drama", "Sci-Fi", "Short", "All"], "description": " A phone booth on an ocean cliffside brings together seven strangers whose seemingly different conversations are connected by one harrowing reality.", "video_link": "https://player.vimeo.com/video/319117377?dnt=1&app_id=122963", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/wind-phone-481x410.jpeg", "location": "Charles R. Wood Theater Cabaret Space", "date": "03/01/2020 05:12 PM to 03/01/2020 05:22 PM,03/05/2020 05:11 PM to 03/05/2020 06:32 PM"}}, {"1599": {"title": "Family Rewritten", "category": ["Doc", "Short", "All"], "description": " Despite battling Cystic Fibrosis, Camilla, age 16, identifies as a typical middle-class American teenager until the thread that holds her family together suddenly snaps. Just months before her 18th birthday Camilla finds herself in foster care, but instead of being ashamed, she makes a conscious decision to not let her situation define her.", "video_link": "https://player.vimeo.com/video/199356473?dnt=1&app_id=122963", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/FamilyRewritten_Photo_01-481x410.jpg", "location": "Charles R. Wood Theater Cabaret Space", "date": "03/02/2020 09:44 PM to 03/02/2020 08:00 PM,03/02/2020 11:16 PM to 03/02/2020 08:11 PM"}}, {"1754": {"title": "The Dendrite", "category": ["Drama", "Sci-Fi", "Short", "All"], "description": " An arborist investigates a strange tree overtaking the house of a librarian.", "video_link": "", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/dendrite-481x410.jpeg", "location": "Charles R. Wood Theater Cabaret Space", "date": "03/02/2020 05:31 PM to 03/02/2020 05:50 PM,03/07/2020 10:38 AM to 03/07/2020 11:21 AM"}}, {"1630": {"title": "Light", "category": ["Sci-Fi", "Short", "All"], "description": " Darkness takes the world, with only around 10 minutes of light left each day. Humanity is dying. A gifted young woman is sent out into the darkness in a last-ditch effort to find a lifeline. If she returns empty-handed, or without the guard sent out with her to document the findings, she\u2019ll be left to the darkness, and whatever lies within. A 21st-Century reinterpretation of a Cherokee oral story.", "video_link": "https://player.vimeo.com/video/308477756?dnt=1&app_id=122963", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/LIGHT-481x410.jpeg", "location": "Crandall Public Library", "date": "03/02/2020 01:31 AM to 03/02/2020 05:36 PM,03/05/2020 08:08 PM to 03/05/2020 07:42 PM"}}, {"1717": {"title": "Violence", "category": ["Drama", "Short", "All"], "description": " A woman\u2019s home invasion abduction is documented by three recording devices, but her murder remains a mystery.", "video_link": "https://player.vimeo.com/video/320056654?dnt=1&app_id=122963", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/violence-481x410.png", "location": "Charles R. Wood Theater", "date": "03/01/2020 04:32 PM to 03/01/2020 05:30 PM,03/07/2020 06:32 PM to 03/07/2020 06:54 PM"}}, {"1801": {"title": "Portraits of my mother (Retratos de mi madre)", "category": ["Doc", "Short", "All"], "description": " This is a documentary about my mother and the moment that changed her life. Through her narration, my mother confesses to me what she remembers from the moment she was raped as a child. By painfully recalling this traumatic moment, she reflects on the sexual abuse of children and the scars that these events leave in a person\u2019s life.", "video_link": "https://player.vimeo.com/video/314252505?dnt=1&app_id=122963", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/portraits-481x410.png", "location": "The Park Theater", "date": "03/05/2020 02:01 PM to 03/05/2020 04:42 PM,03/04/2020 06:58 AM to 03/04/2020 09:05 AM"}}, {"1702": {"title": "The Orchestra", "category": ["Drama", "Short", "All"], "description": " A young woman is haunted by an undead orchestra when she finds herself alone in an empty theatre.", "video_link": "https://player.vimeo.com/video/341912713?dnt=1&app_id=122963", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/orchestra-481x410.jpeg", "location": "Charles R. To reach Justine, Becky, must open her own padlocked past and finds herself drawn closer to the abyss than she ever expected.", "video_link": "https://player.vimeo.com/video/290066596?dnt=1&app_id=122963", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/how-you-do-you-type-481x410.jpeg", "location": "Charles R. Wood Theater Cabaret Space", "date": "03/04/2020 12:38 PM to 03/04/2020 03:47 PM,03/05/2020 09:18 PM to 03/05/2020 08:50 PM"}}, {"2151": {"title": "JoJo Rabbit", "category": ["Comedy", "Headliner", "Special Event", "All"], "description": " Jojo is a lonely German boy who discovers that his single mother is hiding a Jewish girl in their attic. For attempting such a radical act, Grant\u2019s rural community of 700 people were sued by a corporation, then by the state government, and are now locked in a battle to defend the watershed they call home, the water they drink, and enforce the local laws they enacted that gave legal Rights to Nature. Half a continent away in Standing Rock, North Dakota, the same industry threatening Grant Twp. is using militarized force against indigenous tribes and allies fighting to protect Mother Earth. The two, Grant Township and Standing Rock, are joined in an international fight to protect more than just water. They fight for their community, democracy, and for Nature as a living entity unto itself. Produced by award-winning actor Mark Ruffalo, INVISIBLE HAND takes you behind the curtain of the global economy where \u2018Rights of Nature\u2019 becomes \u201ccapitalism\u2019s one true opponent.\u201d \u00a0", "video_link": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/tNVi1H4ccrA?feature=oembed", "image": "https://www.adkfilmfestival.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/invisible-481x410.jpeg", "location": "Crandall Public Library", "date": "03/03/2020 12:39 AM to 03/03/2020 01:06 AM,03/02/2020 08:12 PM to 03/02/2020 07:07 PM"}}, {"1628": {"title": "Little Texas", "category": ["Drama", "Short", "All"], "description": " Ellie, a teen from deep in the heart of Texas, is in trouble.
